relation: Counts as a reader any identity that has selected the shared IMAP folder within the indicated number of days. The default is 30.

Does not count users who have not selected the shared IMAP folder within the indicated number of months. The default is infinity and removes the seen flag data for those users. This option also removes the “seen” flag data for those users from the store.
List the shared folders shared to that specific user.
pageTitle: Chapter 1 Messaging Server Command-line Utilities (Sun Java System Messaging Server 6.3 Administration Reference)
TableContextTimeStampAfterTable: {113468=Date from which messages are to be backed up, expressed in YYYYMMDD [:HHMMSS]; for example, -d 19990501:131000 would backup messages stored from May 1, 1999 at 1:10 pm to the present. The default is to back up all the messages regardless of their dates., 145093=May be run remotely., 21290=Specifies the name of the configuration parameter that you wish to view or modify. May be used with the -H, -v, -d options. Configuration parameter names starting with the word local are stored in the local server configuration file., 133133=The month is specified by mm. The day is specified by dd. The year is specified by yy. For example, 052097 specifies May 20 in the year 1997. The time of day is specified by HHMMSS. For example 110000 specifies 11:00am., 173071=The max_thread parameter must be set between 1 and 1024. }
textBeforeTable: The options for this command are: Options configutil -i inputfile configutil [-f configfile] [-p pattern] [-H] [-m] [-V] configutil [-h] [-f configfile] [-o option[;language] [-v value]   Syntax       to: /opt/SUNWmsgsr/data/store/partition/primary store.partition.primary.path is currently set Default: <msg.RootPath>/data/store/partition/primary Syntax: filepath Flags: MSG_RESTART_ALL Description: Full path name of the primary partition. Configuration option: store.partition.primary.path to: /opt/SUNWmsgsr/data/store/partition/two store.partition.two.path is currently set to: /opt/SUNWmsgsr/data/store/partition/three store.partition.three.path is currently set to: /opt/SUNWmsgsr/data/store/partition/primary store.partition.primary.path is currently set Default: NULL (unset) Syntax: filepath Flags: MSG_RESTART_ALL Description: Controls the store index file directory path. Configuration option: store.partition.*.path # ./configutil -p store.partition.\*.path -H ### Show help on store.partition.\*.path service.pop.port is currently set to: 110 Default: 110 Syntax: uint Flags: MSG_RESTART_POP Description: POP server port number. Configuration option: service.pop.port service.imap.port is currently set to: 143 Default: 143 Syntax: uint Flags: MSG_RESTART_IMAP Description: IMAP server port number. Configuration option: service.imap.port service.http.port is currently set to: 81 Default: 80 Syntax: uint Flags: MSG_RESTART_HTTP Description: Messenger Express HTTP port. Configuration option: service.http.port metermaid.config.port is currently set to: 63837 Default: 63837 Syntax: tcpport connections. Description: Port number on which MeterMaid listens for Configuration option: metermaid.config.port local.webmail.sieve.port is currently unset Default: NULL (unset) Syntax: string has been deployed. Description: The port of the web container where the Mail Filter Configuration option: local.webmail.sieve.port local.webmail.da.port is currently set to: 8080 Default: 8080 Syntax: int Description: Delegated Administrator port. Configuration option: local.webmail.da.port
textAfterTable: -i inputfile Imports configurations from a file. Data in the file to be entered in option=value format with no spaces on either side of the pipe. The inputfile should be specified as an absolute path.     -m Lists meta data.  -o option Specifies the name of the configuration parameter that you wish to view or modify. May be used with the -H, -v, -d options. Configuration parameter names starting with the word local are stored in the local server configuration file. -p pattern Lists only options with the given pattern (* is wildcard). Example: configutil - p \*enable -H If no wildcard is present in the pattern, a wildcard at the end of the pattern will be assumed (effectively changing pattern to pattern\*). -v value Specifies a value for a configuration parameter. To be used with -o option. -V Enables you to validate the configuration against meta data.  If you specify no command-line options, all configuration parameters are listed.
